title.narrative: Lesotho - Rural Health Services Project (RIISP) IV
Lesotho - Rural Health Services Project (RIISP) IV

description.narrative: The Fourth Rural Health Services project has been designed to strengthen basic health care delivery in rural areas of Lesotho. It should enable district hospitals at Berea, Qacha’s Net and Mokhotlong to provide secondary health care needed to back up primary health care delivered by rural clinics in the concerned health Service Areas. The project should complement the action of the Second and Third Rural Health services Projects. The project comprises five main components, namely: i) Mokhotlong Hospital rehabilitation and upgrading; ii) Berea Hospital rehabilitation and upgrading; iii) Qacha’s Nek Hospital rehabilitation and upgrading; iv) Institutional capacity in the three district hospitals strengthened in improved back-up and referral operations and services; and v) Project Management.
The beneficiaries of the project are the vulnerable populations of the districts of Berea, Qacha's Net and Mokhotlong.

The sector goal is to improve the health status of target populations in rural areas of Lesotho. The project objective is to strengthen secondary health care services through the rehabilitation and upgrading of three Government District Hospitals and training of related health staff.

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF LESOTHO MINISTRY OF FINANCE
